snippet: Over two months, hackers gained entry to dozens of the bank’s servers, said three people with knowledge of the bank’s investigation into the episode.
abstract: Investigation into two-month-long attack on JPMorgan Chase's computer network is attempting to uncover extent of damage; breach may have given hackers window into how bank's individual computer systems operate, making it difficult for bank to find every vulnerability and secure its computers against future attacks.

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: Over two months, hackers gained entry to dozens of the bank’s servers, said three people with knowledge of the bank’s investigation into the episode.

headline.main: After Breach, JPMorgan Still Seeks to Determine Extent of Attack
headline.print_headline: Bank Still Seeks to Assess Extent of Breach
